description.narrative:
G4AW: http://g4aw.spaceoffice.nl/en/ NSO: http://www.spaceoffice.nl/en/
GEOBIS uses spatial and other geodata for providing effective, time and location specific advisory services to smallholder farmers in Bangladesh. It is aimed at improving agricultural productivity and farmer income, upgrading agricultural zoning and at improving the management of weather related emergencies.

GEOBIS will provide farmers with weather related information, advice on the usage of seeds, land preparation, sowing, transplanting, irrigation, fertilizers and agrochemicals, and advice on preventive and remedial measures for controlling pest and diseases. Farmers will be informed through mobile phones, call centre, a website, app-based services as well as personal advice via extension officers and Lal Teer’s field staff. Since illiteracy rates are high and the usage of smartphones is limited, the network of extension officers will initially be the most important channel in conjunction with the mobile phone. Throughout the project, GEOBISpartners will encourage and expect the involved farmers to become more knowledgeable and technologically independent.
Geodata Based Information Services for smallholder farmers in Bangladesh

The primary users are farmers in 14 Northern districts of Bangladesh. They largely practice multi-cropping and cultivate very small plots of land, averaging 0.5 acre. GEOBIS will also cater to the information needs of agricultural researchers and students of its public partner, a local university. At a later stage other potential customers in the financial or retail sector will also be considered.

The project will assess several business propositions, depending on the communication channel used and the farmers’ willingness to pay. Examples are: a fee for a phone call to a customer advisor or interactive voice response, a subscription to text messages or automated outbound calls, a fee for advice from an extension officer, or a subscription to a web-based application.
Important is the reach of the service. The consortium will use the network of extension officers and distribution partners of the applicant to enroll 330,000 farmers as users within 3 years, enabling the service to become economically viable.

title.narrative: Voedselzekerheid verbeteren met satellietdata (blog, 2018, Dutch only)
Sustainability and impact of the programme

description.narrative: At the end of the program an impact study will be executed to gain insight into the sustainability and impact of the entire G4AW program

title.narrative: Performed impact study: Assesment of the sustainability and impact of the program

description.narrative: At the end of the program an impact study will be executed to gain insight into the sustainability and impact of the entire G4AW program. Indicators will include: • Poverty reduction • Increased food security • Increased income security • Improved input efficiency • Sustainable water use • Increased resilience • Climate change adaptation • Gender equality • Sustainable development stakeholders • Sustainable economic growth
Number of food producers (#) with an improvement (%) as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.
Improvement (%) in food production as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.

comment.narrative: Most projects and corresponding partnerships were formed within this program, having no previous results. Furthermore, most projects need an initial technical development and gained support and commitment of involved stakeholders before any real results can be reached. As a result, most projects do not start to achieve significant results until the third year of operation.
End of programme goal: average >10% increase among all individual projects

description.narrative: Improvement (%) in income as a result of using the service(s) provided within the project.

title.narrative: More effective use of inputs; water, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides

description.narrative: Improvement in effective use of water, seeds, fertilizer and pesticides as a result of using the service(s)

comment.narrative: Most projects and corresponding partnerships were formed within this program, having no previous results. Furthermore, most projects need an initial technical development and gained support and commitment of involved stakeholders before any real results can be reached. As a result, most projects do not start to achieve significant results until the third year of operation.
End of programme goal: More food producers are having access to inputs, and food producers already using inputs are using these inputs more effectively (>10% increase).
18-07-2019: Effective use of water: NA Effective use of seeds: 5 % Effective use of fertilizer: 2 % Effective use of pesticides: 5 %
